q: If you need inspiration, don't do it.
h:
“If you need inspiration, don't do it.” —
Elon Musk

q: There is no truth. There is only perception.
h:
“There is no truth. There is only perception.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
h:
“A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.” —
Unknown

q: Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.
h:
“Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.” —
Celestine Chua

q: If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal.
h:
“If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: What we dwell on is who we become.
h:
“What we dwell on is who we become.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Greatness lies not in being strong, but in the right use of strength.
h:
“Greatness lies not in being strong, but in the right use of strength.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.
h:
“There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: By seeking and blundering we learn.
h:
“By seeking and blundering we learn.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: The truly rich men are the ones who have health, loved ones and a work they love.
h:
“The truly rich men are the ones who have health, loved ones and a work they love.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic.
h:
“The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic. ” —
Woody Allen

q: It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little; do something.
h:
“It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little; do something.” —
Sydney Smith

q: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
h:
“We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: You may delay, but time will not.
h:
“You may delay, but time will not.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.
h:
“If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.” —
Alexander Pope

q: Some of us learn from other people's mistakes and the rest of us have to be other people.
h:
“Some of us learn from other people's mistakes and the rest of us have to be other people. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
h:
“Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.” —
Michael Jordan

q: I want the fishing rod, not the fish.
h:
“I want the fishing rod, not the fish.” —
Yanni

q: The price of inaction is far greater than the cost of making a mistake.
h:
“The price of inaction is far greater than the cost of making a mistake.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.
h:
“Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: To be in harmony with the wholeness of things is not to have anxiety over imperfections.
h:
“To be in harmony with the wholeness of things is not to have anxiety over imperfections.” —
Dogen

q: A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.
h:
“A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: When something comes from within, when it is a part of you, you have no choice but to live it, to express it.
h:
“When something comes from within, when it is a part of you, you have no choice but to live it, to express it.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: To perceive is to suffer.
h:
“To perceive is to suffer.” —
Aristotle

q: Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.
h:
“Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.” —
Socrates

q: Even if you persuade me, you won't persuade me.
h:
“Even if you persuade me, you won't persuade me.” —
Aristophanes

q: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
h:
“When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.
h:
“Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.
h:
“Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.” —
Unknown

q: There is always room in your life for thinking bigger, pushing limits and imagining the impossible.
h:
“There is always room in your life for thinking bigger, pushing limits and imagining the impossible.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
h:
“Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Sometimes success isn't about making the right decision, it's more about making some decision.
h:
“Sometimes success isn't about making the right decision, it's more about making some decision.” —
Robin Sharma

q: I succeeded by saying what everyone else is thinking.
h:
“I succeeded by saying what everyone else is thinking.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.
h:
“Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.” —
Steve Jobs

q: There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.” —
Dan Millman

q: Wake up and smile! Wake up and be grateful!
h:
“Wake up and smile! Wake up and be grateful!” —
Steve Harvey

q: The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.
h:
“The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Some of your greatest lessons come from your darkest moments.
h:
“Some of your greatest lessons come from your darkest moments.” —
Roger Lee

q: Don't look back - you're not going that way.
h:
“Don't look back - you're not going that way.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: To be prepared is half the victory.
h:
“To be prepared is half the victory. ” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.
h:
“It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.” —
Voltaire

q: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
h:
“The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Every day do something that will inch you closer to a better tomorrow.
h:
“Every day do something that will inch you closer to a better tomorrow.” —
Unknown

q: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
h:
“Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.” —
Henry Ford

q: A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.
h:
“A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.” —
Barack Obama

q: The destiny of man is in his own soul.
h:
“The destiny of man is in his own soul. ” —
Herodotus

q: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.
h:
“Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.
h:
“The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: If your mind is empty, it is always ready for anything, it is open to everything.
h:
“If your mind is empty, it is always ready for anything, it is open to everything.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: You change the world by being yourself.
h:
“You change the world by being yourself.” —
Yoko Ono

q: There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.
h:
“There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: If you've made a mistake, it's better just to laugh at it.
h:
“If you've made a mistake, it's better just to laugh at it.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Act the way you want to be and soon you'll be the way you act.
h:
“Act the way you want to be and soon you'll be the way you act.” —
Les Brown

q: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
h:
“Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree. ” —
Martin Luther

q: Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.
h:
“Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: The secret of getting started is breaking your complex, overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and then starting on the first one.
h:
“The secret of getting started is breaking your complex, overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and then starting on the first one.” —
Mark Twain

q: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
h:
“Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.” —
Ayn Rand

q: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
h:
“A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
h:
“Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.” —
Alexander Pope

q: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
h:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.
h:
“If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.
h:
“A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.” —
James Allen

q: A Quitter never wins - and - a Winner never quits.
h:
“A Quitter never wins - and - a Winner never quits.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Nothing is easier than fault finding.
h:
“Nothing is easier than fault finding.” —
Og Mandino

q: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
h:
“It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.” —
Epictetus

q: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power.
h:
“One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.
h:
“Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Darkness must pass. A new day will come. And when the sun shines, it will shine out the clearer.
h:
“Darkness must pass. A new day will come. And when the sun shines, it will shine out the clearer.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: You cannot always control what goes on outside. But you can always control what goes on inside.
h:
“You cannot always control what goes on outside. But you can always control what goes on inside. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.
h:
“New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Every one of us is the sum total of his own thoughts.
h:
“Every one of us is the sum total of his own thoughts.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: I am thankful to all who said no to me. It is because of them that I'm doing it myself.
h:
“I am thankful to all who said no to me. It is because of them that I'm doing it myself.” —
Albert Einstein

q: The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.
h:
“The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.” —
Seungsahn

q: Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.
h:
“Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.” —
Robert Greene

q: The future belongs to those who learn more skills and combine them in creative ways.
h:
“The future belongs to those who learn more skills and combine them in creative ways.” —
Robert Greene

q: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
h:
“It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.” —
John Lennon

q: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
h:
“Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.” —
Og Mandino

q: Our greatest glory is not in never falling but in rising every time we fall.
h:
“Our greatest glory is not in never falling but in rising every time we fall.” —
Confucius

q: Imagination is the beginning of creation.
h:
“Imagination is the beginning of creation.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
h:
“Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.” —
Charles Dickens

q: What have you done today to make someone else happy?
h:
“What have you done today to make someone else happy?” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: Everything flows, nothing stands still.
h:
“Everything flows, nothing stands still.” —
Heraclitus

q: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
h:
“If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.
h:
“The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.” —
James Allen

q: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
h:
“There are no shortcuts to any place worth going. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Life is a gift. Never forget to enjoy and bask in every moment you are in.
h:
“Life is a gift. Never forget to enjoy and bask in every moment you are in.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.
h:
“Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.” —
Zhuangzi

q: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
h:
“People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: It doesn't matter if the glass is half empty or half full. Be grateful you have a glass - you're the only person that can decide what's in it.
h:
“It doesn't matter if the glass is half empty or half full. Be grateful you have a glass - you're the only person that can decide what's in it.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
h:
“Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.
h:
“The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.” —
Plato

q: All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope
h:
“All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: Where focus goes, energy flows.
h:
“Where focus goes, energy flows.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Contemplation often makes life miserable.  We should act more, think less, and stop watching ourselves live.
h:
“Contemplation often makes life miserable. We should act more, think less, and stop watching ourselves live.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.
h:
“Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Your mind will make you rich or poor, depending on the use you put to it.
h:
“Your mind will make you rich or poor, depending on the use you put to it.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Don't ever save anything for a special occasion. Being alive is the special occasion.
h:
“Don't ever save anything for a special occasion. Being alive is the special occasion.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.
h:
“Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Do Something. If it works, do more of it. If it doesn't, do something else.
h:
“Do Something. If it works, do more of it. If it doesn't, do something else.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
h:
“The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.” —
Walt Disney
